poem:
**Theatre of Toast**  
  
Coffee steam veils the morning,  
toast crumbs map the landscape,  
daylight skims the surface of speech,  
as secrets thread their quiet dance.  
She spins webs in political parlance;  
he tumbles through classrooms, caulked  
in chalk dust and whispers.  
By dusk, they unspool, shed roles,  
re-strung marionettes on kitchen tiles.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Changes review – secrets, blackmail and lightning fast role-juggling A day in the life of a couple plays out from breakfast to dinner. She is a self-composed politician, he is a burnt-out lawyer turned anxious school teacher. They have been married for 20 years and we meet them in the morning discussing toast, problem students and political campaigns before they set off into their working day. It is ordinary life, given an extraordinary theatrical twist". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
